TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi serializable sealed CompareOptions extends System.Enum

summary.span: Defines the string comparison options to use with .

span.span: Defines the string comparison options to use with .

remarks.format: ## Remarks Queste opzioni indicano distinzione maiuscole/minuscole o se è necessario ignorare i tipi di caratteri.These options denote case sensitivity or necessity to ignore types of characters. .NET Framework Usa tre diverse modalità di ordinamento: word sort, ordinamento per stringhe e ordinamento per ordinale.The .NET Framework uses three distinct ways of sorting: word sort, string sort, and ordinal sort. Ordinamento di Word esegue un confronto con distinzione delle impostazioni cultura delle stringhe.Word sort performs a culture-sensitive comparison of strings. Alcuni caratteri non alfanumerici potrebbero essere determinati i pesi assegnati.Certain nonalphanumeric characters might have special weights assigned to them. Ad esempio, il trattino ("-") potrebbe avere una valenza ridotta a esso in modo che "co-op" e "coop" vengono visualizzati uno accanto a altro in un elenco ordinato.For example, the hyphen ("-") might have a very small weight assigned to it so that "coop" and "co-op" appear next to each other in a sorted list. Ordinamento per stringhe è simile per ordinare in word, ad eccezione del fatto che esistono casi speciali.String sort is similar to word sort, except that there are no special cases. Pertanto, tutti i simboli non alfanumerici precedono tutti i caratteri alfanumerici.Therefore, all nonalphanumeric symbols come before all alphanumeric characters. Ordinamento per ordinale confronta le stringhe in base ai valori Unicode di ogni elemento della stringa.Ordinal sort compares strings based on the Unicode values of each element of the string. Il valore StringSort utilizzabile solo con e .The StringSort value can only be used with and . viene generata un'eccezione se viene utilizzato con il valore di StringSort , , , o . is thrown if the StringSort value is used with , , , or . > [!NOTE] > Quando possibile, l'applicazione deve utilizzare i metodi di confronto tra stringhe che accettano un valore da specificare il tipo di confronto previsto.When possible, the application should use string comparison methods that accept a value to specify the kind of comparison expected. Come regola generale, i confronti agli utenti finali siano soddisfatti in modo ottimale mediante l'utilizzo di opzioni linguistiche, utilizzando le impostazioni cultura correnti, mentre la sicurezza è necessario specificare i confronti Ordinal o OrdinalIgnoreCase.As a general rule, user-facing comparisons are best served by the use of linguistic options (using the current culture), while security comparisons should specify Ordinal or OrdinalIgnoreCase. ## Examples Esempio di codice seguente viene illustrato l'ordinamento con StringSort differenze tra l'ordinamento senza StringSort.The following code example shows how sorting with StringSort differs from sorting without StringSort. [!code-cpp[System.Globalization.CompareOptions.StringSort#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Globalization.CompareOptions.StringSort/CPP/compareoptions_stringsort.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[System.Globalization.CompareOptions.StringSort#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Globalization.CompareOptions.StringSort/CS/compareoptions_stringsort.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Globalization.CompareOptions.StringSort#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Globalization.CompareOptions.StringSort/VB/compareoptions_stringsort.vb#1)]

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Globalization.CompareOptions IgnoreCase = int32(1)

summary.span: Indicates that the string comparison must ignore case.

span.span: Indicates that the string comparison must ignore case.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Globalization.CompareOptions IgnoreKanaType = int32(8)

summary.span: Indicates that the string comparison must ignore the Kana type.

span.span: Indicates that the string comparison must ignore the Kana type.

summary.span: Kana type refers to Japanese hiragana and katakana characters, which represent phonetic sounds in the Japanese language.

span.span: Kana type refers to Japanese hiragana and katakana characters, which represent phonetic sounds in the Japanese language.

summary.span: Hiragana is used for native Japanese expressions and words, while katakana is used for words borrowed from other languages, such as "computer" or "Internet".

span.span: Hiragana is used for native Japanese expressions and words, while katakana is used for words borrowed from other languages, such as "computer" or "Internet".

summary.span: A phonetic sound can be expressed in both hiragana and katakana.

span.span: A phonetic sound can be expressed in both hiragana and katakana.

summary.span: If this value is selected, the hiragana character for one sound is considered equal to the katakana character for the same sound.

span.span: If this value is selected, the hiragana character for one sound is considered equal to the katakana character for the same sound.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Globalization.CompareOptions IgnoreNonSpace = int32(2)

summary.span: Indicates that the string comparison must ignore nonspacing combining characters, such as diacritics.

span.span: Indicates that the string comparison must ignore nonspacing combining characters, such as diacritics.

summary.span: The [Unicode Standard](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=37123) defines combining characters as characters that are combined with base characters to produce a new character.

span.span: The [Unicode Standard](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=37123) defines combining characters as characters that are combined with base characters to produce a new character.

summary.span: Nonspacing combining characters do not occupy a spacing position by themselves when rendered.

span.span: Nonspacing combining characters do not occupy a spacing position by themselves when rendered.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Globalization.CompareOptions IgnoreSymbols = int32(4)

summary.span: Indicates that the string comparison must ignore symbols, such as white-space characters, punctuation, currency symbols, the percent sign, mathematical symbols, the ampersand, and so on.

span.span: Indicates that the string comparison must ignore symbols, such as white-space characters, punctuation, currency symbols, the percent sign, mathematical symbols, the ampersand, and so on.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Globalization.CompareOptions IgnoreWidth = int32(16)

summary.span: Indicates that the string comparison must ignore the character width.

span.span: Indicates that the string comparison must ignore the character width.

summary.span: For example, Japanese katakana characters can be written as full-width or half-width.

span.span: For example, Japanese katakana characters can be written as full-width or half-width.

summary.span: If this value is selected, the katakana characters written as full-width are considered equal to the same characters written as half-width.

span.span: If this value is selected, the katakana characters written as full-width are considered equal to the same characters written as half-width.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Globalization.CompareOptions None = int32(0)

summary.span: Indicates the default option settings for string comparisons.

span.span: Indicates the default option settings for string comparisons.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Globalization.CompareOptions Ordinal = int32(1073741824)

summary.span: Indicates that the string comparison must use successive Unicode UTF-16 encoded values of the string (code unit by code unit comparison), leading to a fast comparison but one that is culture-insensitive.

span.span: Indicates that the string comparison must use successive Unicode UTF-16 encoded values of the string (code unit by code unit comparison), leading to a fast comparison but one that is culture-insensitive.

summary.span: A string starting with a code unit XXXX16 comes before a string starting with YYYY16, if XXXX16 is less than YYYY16.

span.span: A string starting with a code unit XXXX16 comes before a string starting with YYYY16, if XXXX16 is less than YYYY16.

summary.span: This value cannot be combined with other values and must be used alone.

span.span: This value cannot be combined with other values and must be used alone.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Globalization.CompareOptions OrdinalIgnoreCase = int32(268435456)

summary.span: String comparison must ignore case, then perform an ordinal comparison.

span.span: String comparison must ignore case, then perform an ordinal comparison.

summary.span: This technique is equivalent to converting the string to uppercase using the invariant culture and then performing an ordinal comparison on the result.

span.span: This technique is equivalent to converting the string to uppercase using the invariant culture and then performing an ordinal comparison on the result.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Globalization.CompareOptions StringSort = int32(536870912)

summary.span: Indicates that the string comparison must use the string sort algorithm.

span.span: Indicates that the string comparison must use the string sort algorithm.

summary.span: In a string sort, the hyphen and the apostrophe, as well as other nonalphanumeric symbols, come before alphanumeric characters.

span.span: In a string sort, the hyphen and the apostrophe, as well as other nonalphanumeric symbols, come before alphanumeric characters.
